subject: The Perl Community?
header: I am not sure if you have read recent blog by Neil Bowers. I read it multiple times to understand subject of the blog. I must admit, I never read such an in depth analysis of the term "Community". As it is my vocabulary is very limited, I found very interesting to such a long blog. To me, community is group of likeminded people. When I attended the first London Perl Workshop, I immediately felt part of the community. The organiser and everybody was so accomodating and friendly. It made me come again the following year and I became addicted to it afterwards. I always looked up to the big names of the community everytime I needed some inspiration. Take a look at the past recipients of White Camel Award, you can get the idea of who's who in the community. Unfortunately it hasn't been awarded since 2018 for some reason that I am not aware of. I miss the community spirit of attending Perl Conference. You can never experience the feeling unless you attend one. I hope and wish we get back to attending Conferences. Although there has been virtual events in recent time but it can't replace the real events in my humble opinion. I must give credits to everyone who is keeping the community spirit alive.

Today is the bank holiday in England, so all the English readers of the newsletter enjoy your break with the newsletter. Rest of the world, start your week with weekly doses of Perl news. Stay safe and healthy.
